##I love this show.

Seriously, I think I'm ready to call it as my AOTS. I find I usually get the most enjoyment out of shows that aren't the most popular. Last season it was BanG Dream, the season before that Magical Girl Raising Project, and so on.

This show just does humor so well, and the chargers are all so lovable. I'm ecstatic that Funimation is dubbing this so I can get my Blurays for it.

Welcome to the [happy party train with Naoto-sama!](http://i.imgur.com/hXCvV9t.jpg)  
[Seriously](http://i.imgur.com/QninEOh.jpg)...[this guy](http://i.imgur.com/QninEOh.jpg)...[is the happiest guy](http://i.imgur.com/PmYbNbN.jpg)...[on this damn planet!!!](http://i.imgur.com/RdI6OE4.jpg)

PS: I would have no other choice but to surrender to AnchoR even if I was her target, [she is way too cute](http://i.imgur.com/GJHp0Wi.jpg) to be hurt in any possible way!
What's with the lines on your pictures? O.o
Naoto each week continues to impress me. The hero of this season because he does what he fucking wants.

This ep was great.  The Halter rescue was cool, Sexbot is a great character, AnchoR is the cutest thing there is, and Naoto married his Robutt Waifu RyuZU.  What an ep.  

I really like this world, the small details make it really interesting.  

I wonder though if Old Man River called Naoto Y's, maybe he knows something about our Hero...  I had suspected that Naoto was probably of the same bloodline as that Y's guy, hence his affinity for mechanics.  

I guess we will see!

Is this show any good?

I started watching the first episode when it aired but dropped it because it seemed bad.


I got serious " I've already seen this show at least 6 times" vibes from the first 5 minutes.

Try the manga instead.   
It has less of the bad stuff and skipped less of good stuff. (The LNs are also an option)

Personally, I'm just watching this to see my favourite scenes and characters animated.

> I got serious " I've already seen this show at least 6 times" vibes from the first 5 minutes.

I dropped it episode 4, but from what I saw, you pretty much hit the nail on the head there.

Personally, I wouldn't recommend it.  There's a self-selecting bias for folks who are still in discussion threads 10 episodes in; as a few others have said, if you didn't like the first episode, you almost certainly won't like the rest of the show.  I loathe dropping shows, so I'm finishing this one out, but it's just not very well executed.

I like a "dumb fun" show as much as the next guy, so it's not coming from a place of elitism. I just found that all the drama and character motivations fall flat, and the action is not nearly good enough to make up for it. The MC's antics can be funny, but they also get to the point where they simply don't make sense and it pulls you out of the show.  They would work better if the show was way less serious overall (like, say, High School DxD), but because it keeps trying to insert serious plot elements, you end up getting mood whiplash, and not in a well-planned way.

Also, this is a really minor complaint, but the author (I'm assuming this stems from the LN source) has some weird fixation on throwing out super specific numbers left and right, and it really started to get on my nerves after a while (perhaps emblematic of the show as a whole).  Here's a random piece of dialogue like that (doesn't spoil anything):

>From your location, jump up 52.3 meters.  
>Rotate 47.5 degrees horizontally, then jump another 14.25 meters.  
>After you arrive, there will be a loose gear with a diameter of 0.7 micrometers.  

You'll get multiple bits of dialogue like this every episode, and it's totally immersion breaking.  I get that the characters are supposed to be geniuses and all, but this level of specificity strains credibility, seems completely unnecessary, and in the case of that small gear, makes no sense. A human hair is about 50 micrometers in diameter, so a 0.7 micrometer gear would be invisible to the naked eye...but it's clearly shown in the show without magnification, probably more on the order of millimeters in diameter.

**TL;DR: Want a silly comedy show? Check out Renai Boukun. But if you didn't like the first episode of Clockwork Planet, you can feel confident in dropping this show.**

I don't think the show is good but I can watch and enjoy parts of it.

Pros are if you just want to watch something light hearted and comical. Jokes aren't amazing but I enjoy them enough. I think the character designs are great. I like the quirkyness of the characters as well.

Cons are that ultimately it's not the most entertaining thing ever. The story is kinda boring to me personally.

It basically rides on you enjoying character interactions. While it's a bit cheap, if you like the characters then you'll find it watchable.
It's just pure dumb fun. The MC and his robot wife are hilarious and the soundtrack is the best of the season IMO.
fripSide for an opening and still somehow has a better ending song (in my opnion).
I honestly dont think the OP is anything special, I like the ED though.  But I was moreso talking about the OST in general.

It's a very specific show for specific people.

People who like fun. Because that's what this show is. It's just pure fun. I'd argue it's an action comedy, though the action is nothing special, but the comedy is fantastic.

All the characters are a lot of fun. The Naoto knows what he wants and goes for it. RyuZU is sharp tongued with great dere moments. Even Marie it's a lot of fun.

If you didn't like it on episode one, I don't think you'll come to like it, but I wouldn't call it particularly generic. Though I haven't seen many shows from pre-2007.

If you dropped it on episode 1 then the show isn't for you. I think the show is pretty capable though. Naoto is hilarious and is very shameless with his kinks and fetishes and RyuZU is an absolute treat to watch, the relationship between them is pretty nice too. While RyuZU insults Naoto a lot she never gets violent with him and shows that she's pretty much in love with him as much as Naoto is with her.

Nothing special with the animation but the use of 3D for the gears is pretty neat. Soundtrack is one of the best this season though.

Yeah, I'm late AF to this thread. 

I'd say episode 2 gives a better feel for the show, but second the 
> if you don't like this episode, you won't like the series 
vibe.
Its alright. It feels like a mid 2004-2005 anime, so if you're in the mood for that then you'll probably find some enjoyment here.
Wait, if RyuZU is Model 1 and AnchoR is Model 4, will we see Models 2 and 3? Will Naoto also adopt/marry them (assuming Models 2 and 3 are also female)?
I honestly can't even take this show anymore. I am dropping this show, save 40 minutes.
